intro: Schoenus oliganthos, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bulrush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of lakes and rivers. Its slender, grass-like leaves are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in early spring. Schoenus oliganthos plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
